description.narrative: The Lebanon Environmental Pollution Abatement Project (LEPAP) aims at reducing industrial pollution in targeted industrial enterprises and to strengthen the monitoring and enforcement capabilities of the Ministry of Environment.
Support to the Lebanon Environmental Pollution Abatement Project (LEPAP)
Energy - policy, planning and administration

-Number of environmental audits prepared and implemented by industries -Number of Environmental Compliance Certificates for industries with successful interventions issued by MOE -Number of applicants for LEPAP financing

comment.narrative: - Weak enforcement and limited monitoring related to environmental laws and regulations - Limited environmental awareness and lack of compliance guidelines for industries

title.narrative: Engagement Facility - Lebanon Crisis Response Plan

description.narrative: This Facility Project has been developed to support the stabilization and recovery programme.
This Facility Project has been developed to support the stabilization and recovery programme.

title.narrative: Preparation of HCFC Phase-out Management Plan (HPMP) II

description.narrative: In compliance with the Montreal Protocol, the project’ s objective is to prepare a comprehensive HPMP (Stage-2) for Lebanon, which will incorporate the strategy and action plan for Lebanon for compliance with the post 2015 control targets.

title.narrative: Preparation of HCFC Phase-out Management Plan (HPMP) II
Preparation of HCFC Phase-out Management Plan (HPMP) II

description.narrative: In compliance with the Montreal Protocol, the project’ s objective is to prepare a comprehensive HPMP (Stage-2) for Lebanon, which will incorporate the strategy and action plan for Lebanon for compliance with the post 2015 control targets.
independent political entity
Energy - policy, planning and administration
National strategy and action plan for Lebanon for compliance with the post 2015 control targets are elaborated and submitted to the Executive Committee of the Montreal Protocol.

comment.narrative: Strategy and action plan for Lebanon to comply with the post 2015 control targets do not exist.
-Awareness material and activities are implemented; -Database of the national survey in the foam & RAC sectors is updated.

title.narrative: Enhancing Decision-Making Capacities at the OPCM

description.narrative: The project's main outcome is: "Capacity Development of the Office of the Council of Ministers (OPCM) for Public Policy Reforms Enhanced".

title.narrative: Enhancing Decision-Making Capacities at the Office of the President of the Council of Ministers

description.narrative: Enhancing Decision-Making Capacity

- Restructuring plans developed - Coordination initiatives enhanced -Launch specific social and economic projects including support to entrepreneurs - E-government platform and tools developed - Regular ICT Ministerial Committee meetings held at least quarterly - Number of developed ICT policies and regulations - Internal and external communication strategies developed and tested - Number of publications drafted and disseminated - Number of infrastructural projects developed and implemented

comment.narrative: Need for more thorough coordination among institutions on policies The national e-strategy plan is developed but needs implementation and follow-up Successful implementation of infrastructural projects, that need to be enhanced and further elaborated

1. Reform of the statistical system in Lebanon 2. Improving the business environment in Lebanon 3. National Poverty Targeting Program supported 4. Cultural and Religious Tourism plan resumed 5. e-strategy plan followed-up

1. Amendments suggested to reform the central administration of statistics, maintaining its independence from political interventions and strengthening its authority. 2. Supported the central bank in developing a circular to settle debt resolution cases of companies, a draft law on preferred shares submitted to parliament. 3. Funds were secured to provide e-card voucher for 5,027 deprived households. More funds were mobilized to increase target in 2016 (aiming at 27,000 households). 4. Resumed the Cultural and Religious Tourism project. Discussions launched with municipalities and religious groups. 5. Coordinating e-strategy/ICT work with ministries to generate new ICT policies, all finalized and submitted to the Council of Ministers. Finalize equipment of 5 regional operations rooms on disaster risk management. Kick started phase 1 of the automation process of the Office of the Presidency of the Council of Ministers.

- Coordinate among Key Ministries and institutions including Ministries of Finance, Economy and Trade, Social Affairs, and IDAL, to propose relevant public policy reform plans and develop a medium-term development strategy - Provide Technical Support to the Central Administration of Statistics for a reform program for the statistical system and an implementation plan - Support in developing social development policies and coordinate the implementation of the Regional Development Strategy - Coordinate with OMSAR for developing e-government electronic tools and services and implementing them in at least 4 pilot projects - Coordinate with key ministries to Re-launch the meetings of the ICT Ministerial Committee - Coordinate with key ministries to propose at least 4 ICT/e-Governance procedures and policies - Support to Updating the ICT Watch website - Provide guidelines and technical support to the OPCM and other government agencies on all infrastructure projects

description.narrative: This project seeks to strengthen the capacity of the LPDC to implement its strategic Plan (2015-2020) that enables the GoL to set up a comprehensive policy on the Palestinian refugee issues
This project seeks to strengthen the capacity of the LPDC to implement its strategic Plan (2015-2020) that enables the GoL to set up a comprehensive policy on the Palestinian refugee issues
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

•Number of options for the organizational structure of LPDC •Number of options for the revised mandate of LPDC presented to the PM • Number of comparative studies conducted to explore the structures and mandates of parallel regional institutions dealing with Palestine refugees •Number of consultation sessions with political leaders to promote the draft law • Framework for collaboration between Palestinian and Lebanese authorities is set and activated. • Number of recruited international and local consultants. • Media campaign successfully implemented; • Number of census steering committee meetings; •Number of surveyed refugee camps and gatherings; • Census result analysed and published. • Number of meetings held with MOIM and DPRA • Number of options for computerizing the DPRA functions • Number of options for restructuring the DPRA for more effectiveness •# of coordination meetings and workshops. •# of regional platforms attended. •PRS registry system created at the Ministry of Interior. • Amount of funds received for Nahr El-Bared Project. • # f completed Units in NBC. • # of dialogue sessions. • Level of participation and commitments in Dialogue. • # of recommendations signed by the Working Group representatives.

comment.narrative: • Broad mandate of the LPDC in the 2005 decree. • A very broad and an undetailed 2013 draft law for the formation of the higher commission for Palestine Refugees. • Lack of official information on Palestinian refugees from public institutions. • Inconstancy in Palestinian refugees numbers and profiles across agencies. • Lack of policy-led tools based o accurate knowledge and information. • Absence of informative and analyzed statistical Data within governmental bodies. • Outdated registry records and deteriorated services provided to Palestinian refugees • DPRA administration still not computerized • The role of the DPRA has been limited to issuing personal status records • Lack of inter-governmental coordination on issues of camps and Gatherings. • Inconstancy in LPDC’s inter-ministerial committee meetings and decisions. • Lack of a culture of rights for Palestinian refugees among public institutions and service providers. • Ambiguity in institutional policies and procedures within ministries. •Shortage in the Nahr el-Bared reconstruction funding of $ 153 M. • Arrival of 43,000 newly arrived Palestinian and Syrian refugees from Syria in Lebanon. • Lack of a responsible stakeholder / institution in Palestinian portfolio other than LPDC. • Weak presence of the Lebanese Government in international and regional platforms (such as UNRWA Advisory Commission) that treats the Palestinian refugees. • Absence of official dialogue platforms among Lebanese and Palestinians. • Absence of Lebanese political unified position on the governmental policies towards refugees.

• New organizational structure of LPDC approved by PM • New mandate of LPDC approved by cabinet •The first Comprehensive Census for Palestinian refugees in Lebanon being completed. •Quantitative consistent data generated from the three geographical distinctions (camps, gatherings and camp adjacent areas) are validated and used as a National reference for interventions programming. •Endorsement of the results of the Census by Palestinian partners, international agencies and the Government of Lebanon. • Capacity assessment report for DPRA completed • MOIM adopts new organizational structure for DPRA • Personal status documentations computerized •Participation of actors and coordination mechanisms established between the different sets of actors. • Concerned Ministries are positively engaged in supporting the Palestinian refugees. •More coordinated interventions at the national level in Palestinian camps and gatherings. • Contribution of Lebanon as a host country in developing UNRWA’s Strategic Response Plan 2016-2021. • Thematic working groups are active and centrally led by LPDC. • Scale-up the governmental policies and services for PRS to meet the standards provided to the Syrian refugees. • Continuing the reconstruction of Nahr El-Bared Camp. • Lebanese political parties’ agreement over the strategic approach towards Palestinian refugees in Lebanon. • Lebanese political parties’ facilitation for implementing procedural measures that improves the living conditions of PRs. • Building the consensus of Lebanese political parties around the necessity for improving the living conditions of PRs in Lebanon as an entry for stabilizing the camps.

description.narrative: The project responds to immediate needs requested by national counterparts at the MoIM and at the same time, the initiation phase will assist the CO in developing a rule of law project that serves for long term purposes

The project responds to immediate needs requested by national counterparts at the MoIM and at the same time, the initiation phase will assist the CO in developing a rule of law project that serves for long term purposes
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

comment.narrative: -No programme dedicated for community police and access to justice; -ongoing projects do not respond to ROL needs in host communities -DFID, EU and INL had already identified common areas in their plans but UNDP didn’t receive funds for ROL programming -25 crisis cells are created without being provided with the necessary tools or training

-full-fledge project that is integrated to the social stability response strategy -Project document endorsed by the international partners -50% of the new project budget is already secured -Clear governance structure and accountability mechanisms developed -Functioning crisis cells that monitor the social stability situation across the country -Utilized data that inform the social, economic and security policies and plans in the country

description.narrative: Together Towards Sustainable Development (T2SD) is a UNDP Lebanon strategic policy initiative bringing together businesses that are committed to aligning their efforts with seven standards in five policy areas.

Together Towards Sustainable Development (T2SD) is a UNDP Lebanon strategic policy initiative bringing together businesses that are committed to aligning their efforts with seven standards in five policy areas.
Improving Living Conditions in Palestinian Gatherings Host Communities: Towards More Comprehensive and Sustainable Solutions.

description.narrative: the project will seek to strengthen the resilience of the forty-two Palestinian gatherings host communities through enhancing living conditions.

description.narrative: This project aims at reinforcing Government efforts to strengthen technical capabilities in key sectors and institutions, and establishing a mechanism whereby expatriate nationals can make contributions to development at modest cost.
Institutional capacity gaps addressed through the implementation of TOKTEN missions
Elections - elections

comment.narrative: - Implement at least 6 missions, among which at least 3 with new beneficiary institutions - Develop at least 3 new forms of partnership with stakeholders - Increase TOKTEN's expatriate database of at least 10% (with a special focus on women) - Develop and implement a new Communication strategy
